ADULT EDUCATION
WORKSHOPS
MINI WORKSHOPS
YOUTH EDUCATION
ONE NIGHT EVENTS
LECTURES
JOIN OUR TEAM
Teach with Us!
Arts Bonita has a dynamic and rapidly expanding arts program that takes pride in offering a diverse range of adult & youth classes in both visual and performing arts. We are dedicated to fostering creativity, expression, and skill development in our students, and we're on the lookout for exceptional educators to join our team. As a quality arts program, we believe in providing top-notch instruction to our students, and we're committed to nurturing the talents and passions of individuals of all skill levels. If you're a prospective teacher with a passion for the arts and a desire to make a meaningful impact, consider joining Arts Bonita as we continue to grow and inspire the artistic community.
Please fill out the listed instructor application form(s) that apply to you.
Instructors must also fill out an
instructor bio form
.

Donate Now
Volunteer / Careers
ARTS BONITA RESIDENT ARTISTS
Take a Survey
Gift Store
Support Arts Bonita
Arts Bonita is a not-for-profit organization supported by our generous members, donors and corporate partnerships. Our goal is to provide a wide range of affordable cultural activities that appeal to the whole family and improve quality of life in our community. Your support is paramount to achieving this goal.
Donate
Donate now and help support what you love! Your contribution allows us to provide affordable cultural activities that appeal to the whole family and improve the quality of life in our community.
Donate Now
Membership
Become a member of Arts Bonita and you can enjoy a host of benefits including significant discounts on adult and youth classes, purchases in the gift shop, performance tickets and more-all while supporting a worthwhile community arts organization.
Join Now
Volunteer
Help make Arts for All possible by becoming an Arts Bonita Volunteer-it's fun, easy and very rewarding! We have great opportunities for helpers of all ages. Why not share some of your time with Arts Bonita and help share the arts with others?

THE ARTS BONITA RESIDENCY PROGRAM
The residency program is designed to provide artists with a nurturing and supportive environment to explore, create, and showcase their work.
Apply to Residency Program
Our centers offer state-of-the-art facilities catering to both visual and performing arts. Artists have access to spacious studios, rehearsal spaces, exhibition areas, and a range of specialized equipment to support their artistic practice.
We believe in the power of art to inspire and connect communities. As part of the residency program, artists will be encouraged to engage with the community through workshops, exhibitions, lectures, and public performances. This interaction fosters dialogue, promotes cultural exchange, and expands the reach of the artist’s work. This program provides exposure and recognition for the artists, allowing them to share their creative vision with a wider audience.
Artists interested in the residency program are invited to submit an application consisting of their portfolio, artist statement, and project proposal. A selection committee comprised of art professionals and our staff members will review the applications and select the artists based on the strength of their work, artistic potential, and alignment with our mission.
Our Artist Residency Program aims to provide a transformative and enriching experience for artists, nurturing their creative growth and fostering a vibrant artistic community. We welcome artists from diverse backgrounds and disciplines to join us on this inspiring journey of exploration and artistic discovery.

Information to help you enjoy the Art Festival
Bonita Springs National Art Festivals
Our commitment to presenting quality artwork and a pleasant experience to patrons has resulted in the highest ratings from the national ranking services. View and buy artworks directly from the artists who produce the work. Enjoy the artworks of 200 National and International artists of the highest quality. Art lovers in the Southwest Florida community may view and obtain the work of award-winning artists from the United States, Canada, and Europe. Explore all disciplines of paintings, glass, jewelry, clay works, photography, sculpture, wood, etc.
Great-tasting foods and beverages in a comfortable park setting.
The festivals support the Arts Bonita campuses of the not-for-profit Arts Bonita. There are programs for all ages and all seasons.
Our Commitment
For the Visitors
Every January, February and March,
artists will set up their booths in and around Riverside Park in Bonita Springs and dazzle the public with their talent. Bonita Springs welcomes hundreds of nationally and internationally known artists during the Bonita Springs National Art Festivals. Ranked high nationally and known to artists as one of the best in the country, many apply, approximately 200 accepted by a tough jury panel. That means you get the best‐of‐the‐best to see, an unparalleled and excellent collection of original artwork.
For the Community
Artists generously donate their work at the National Art Festivals
to support Arts Bonita’s Off The Walls celebration, a signature fundraising event that generates essential funds for our educational programs. This generosity enables us to expand our outreach, particularly in Title I schools and through scholarships for emerging artists, where our programs make a profound impact on students. By providing access to arts education in underserved communities, we foster creativity and transform young lives, offering new opportunities for growth, self-expression, and success.
Proceeds Benefit
100% of the proceeds from our festivals are reinvested into the community, shaping a vibrant present and building a brighter future.
Over $55,000 in Summer Camp scholarships providing access to enriching programs for underserved children.
More than $150,000 annually in scholarships for youth to explore their talents in dance, drama, and visual arts.
Over $10,000 awarded annually in college scholarships to support students pursuing higher education in the arts.
Over $7,000 in free exhibitions, receptions, and awards programs for local elementary, middle, and high school students at our campuses, promoting creativity and artistic growth.
Through these initiatives, we are deeply committed to creating opportunities and nurturing the next generation of artists and leaders.

Improv Comedy Arts Jam
Join the fun at The Arts Bonita Improv Comedy Jam, a free 90-minute interactive comedy experience where everyone's welcome to jump in and play! Whether you're a seasoned performer or just improv-curious, you'll have the chance to participate in classic theatre games, short-form scenes, and longer narrative improvisation. Professional improvisers will be on hand to offer supportive coaching and performance tips while you connect with fellow comedy enthusiasts. Come ready to laugh, learn, and be part of the spontaneous comedy magic. No experience necessary—just bring your imagination and sense of adventure.
Improv Jam show is at the Performing Arts Center in the Moe Auditorium

Consistently ranked among the top fine art festivals in the USA, this juried event draws thousands of enthusiastic art lovers and collectors. With the added attention from regional press and a long-standing reputation for excellence, this year provides a unique chance for artists to present their work to an engaged audience. As we celebrate this landmark anniversary, the festival continues its tradition of excellence, making it a must-attend event for both artists and the community.

Our Instructors
Arts Bonita School for the Arts features a dynamic and talented team of passionate instructors in multiple disciplines for youth and adults. With an exciting and ever-expanding lineup of programs, our instructors have the opportunity to profoundly impact the lives of students from diverse backgrounds. We offer an environment that fosters creativity, collaboration, and professional growth. As part of our mission to provide arts education to the community, including underserved populations, instructors contribute to programs with enormous growth potential, both personally and professionally.
Jump to:
Performing Arts Faculty
Visual Arts
Acylic & Oil
Tammy DeCaro
Tammy DeCaro is a self-taught artist from Naples, Florida. She was formally trained in clay arts including wheel throwing, hand building and sculpture. Over the years, her art experience has expanded to include fused glass, jewelry, resin, mixed media, fluid art, and resin. She holds a MSM and BSM in business and in 2022, resigned from 25 years of healthcare leadership to focus on art and healthcare consulting for long term care providers.
As a full time artist, Tammy exhibits in 12-15 art festivals in the Florida area each year. She is sought after for fluid art painted lazy susan’s and has become known as “The Lazy Susan Lady” locally. Her best sellers are large canvases painted with fluid art techniques and large beach resin pieces. She completed a large commercial contract last fall for 15 8’ beach resin pieces and 15 matching mirrors in resin for a condo building on the beach.
Tammy teaches at Arts Bonita using mixed media techniques to create abstract art on canvas, wood panels, and resin art. Her inspiration comes from nature, emotions, or an emotion she wants the viewer to feel when looking at the art.
She provides art instruction in several locations for private groups, corporate team building events, and art centers in SW Florida. She won the Juror’s Choice award at the Rookery Bay Natural Selections Painting exhibit in November 2021 for a tactile beach piece created with resin.
Tammy’s art can be found at art festivals in SWFL during the winter months and at multiple juried exhibitions throughout the SWFL market. She exhibits monthly at Coco Gallery Estero and Coco Gallery Naples.
Richard Kirk
Richard Kirk is an oil painter living in Naples, Florida. Richard's current paintings are whimsical and playful, but he has worked extensively as an illustrator and portrait painter. In addition to his work as a painter and illustrator, he is a dedicated painting instructor. Richard teaches classes at both the Naples Art Institute and Arts Bonita. His classes have included Advanced Oil and Acrylic Painting, Portrait Painting, Beginning Drawing and Figure Drawing. Richard studied illustration at Palomar College in San Marcos, California and established his illustration business in Boston, Massachusetts. His illustration clients included Dexter Shoes, Fidelity Investment, RGA Publishing, Cahners Publishing and Harvard Magazine, to name a few. In addition, Richard has written and self-published four books designed to help his students learn the basics of drawing, painting, portrait painting and color theory.
His fundamental belief about painting shapes his work and his teaching:
"Creating a painting does not make me an artist. Artists create something extraordinary from three primary elements: experience, knowledge and ability. Until I am able to pull instantly from those three primary elements, I am a student. Nevertheless, my taking pride in being a student moves me closer to being an artist."
Julie Tibus
Julie Tibus is a professional artist with over 18 years of experience selling and exhibiting her work. She holds a Bachelor of Fine Arts from the prestigious College for Creative Studies (CCS) in Detroit, Michigan. Besides being an accomplished artist, Julie has also spent several years teaching at her studios in Ann Arbor and Brighton, Michigan. However, in recent times, her passion for exploration and freedom has led her to embrace a full-time nomadic lifestyle. She has sold everything and is now traveling across the USA, teaching, showcasing, and selling her art.
Julie's insatiable curiosity has driven her to experiment with emerging mediums and techniques, constantly pushing the boundaries of her craft. Her work is a beautiful fusion of nature's beauty and her bold, unbridled expression. Julie's love for teaching is also evident in her work, as she shares her passion for art, exploration, and knowledge with others.
Jennifer Unwin
Why do I create?
It's in my soul. I am constantly exploring, experimenting, and enjoying the process of creating something new. The textures, colors, and shapes that permeate the canvas are all part of my personal journey. I have broadened my artistic knowledge through the study of art and art history. I continue to diversify my work by attending classes and workshops.
My work is both abstract and realistic. I have exhibited my work, won awards, sold, and have been commissioned to do paintings. It is truly my exploration in paint and I am most grateful.
Calligraphy
Megan DeSelms
Megan DeSelms is a dermatology PA-C, mom, wife, and lifelong artist. In 2015 she rekindled a childhood love of calligraphy and lettering. Since then, she has diligently studied many script styles with a variety of teachers from around the world, including several Master Penman. She is dedicated to perfecting her craft and preserving the history of fine penmanship through ongoing training and mentorship from leaders in the fields of traditional calligraphy, engrossing, and illumination.
She has worked with hundreds of clients including brides and grooms, private fine art commissions, and a variety of companies and luxury brands such as Nordstrom, Stella Artois, Tiffany, Gucci, Louis Vuitton and more.​ She has been engraving and working with brand activations since 2017.
Ceramics/Pottery
Kel Campbell
Kel Campbell is a ceramic artist and educator but loves to be creative with many art mediums. She is an FGCU graduate and has won multiple awards and recognition for her work. Along with selling her work at Art Festivals on the East Coast she has recently been chosen to be the full time resident artist of cottage number 4 in Downtown Bonita Springs. she is also an active member in the global clay community and participates in National Ceramic Conferences and workshops. Outside of her passion for community involvement and teaching, Kel enjoys cooking, travel, exploring our beautiful beaches and spending time with family and friends.
Sandy Lawson
Sandy is an imaginative and successful artist whose creative work is inspired by travel to Greece, Italy, France, Spain and Portugal. She excels in student motivation and development by creating innovative classroom and workshop environments.
Sandy has been an instructor at Arts Bonita since 2014 and has been instrumental to the development of the current ceramic and pottery curriculum.
Rinny Ryan
Rinny first touched clay in college in 1962. She received her BA in ceramics from the University of Miami and completed her graduate work at Antioch College, The Maryland Institute of Art, and the Penland School of Crafts. Rinny ran the Ceramic Department at Edison College, Ft. Myers for 10 years and also taught at FGCU.
Glass
Susan Berry
Susan Berry has been a glass artist for over forty years and has taught at Arts Bonita for the past six years. Her love of glass began with a year-long study in stained glass and later warm glass technique, to include glass fusing and bead making. In the summer months, Susan teaches stained glass and mosaic classes at the Thousand Islands Art Center in Clayton NY and was the first-place recipient of the Catherine C. Johnson award for her submission to Along the River’s Edge exhibit. Recently, Susan was the Spotlight Artist for the TIAC and her interview can be found on YouTube.
Patrick Mahoney
Patrick Mahoney is originally from Natick, Massachusetts and currently resides in Naples, Florida. Patrick received a bachelors degree in Computer Science and an associates in electronics that helped hone his soldering skills for Stained Glass. Patrick learned the art of stained glass from his father, Don. Patrick works in both lead and copper foil techniques, and has done many commissioned pieces from cabinet door inserts to sidelight windows to standalone statement pieces. Patrick has a passion to make colorful and intricately detailed work that inspires and enchants the viewer, and loves the opportunity to continue this time-honored craft by passing on its practice to aspiring artists.
Jewelry
Barbara Ellis
Barbara Ellis is originally from Chicago, Illinois and graduated from Ringling School of Art and Design In Sarasota Florida. She has received many awards for her work as a licensed Interior Designer and as a creator of fine jewelry. Barbara also creates and designs her own beaded jewelry pieces and patterns. She has been published in ""Beadwork Magazine"" several times with her necklace and bracelets designs. She participates in many of the Toho Challenge events and two of her pieces have traveled to both Japan and Germany on exhibition. She was selected as one of the Bead Dreams Finalist in 2017 and 2019. She is currently showing her one of a kind Beaded Spats on display in the Museum of Beads located in Portland ME.
She shares her craft by teaching at Arts Bonita, and various Embroidery Guild of America events and organizations.
Barbara exhibits with the Naples Artcrafters at monthly tent shows and events, special events at The Shangra La Springs in Bonita Springs and now on Display at The Hand & Harvest Artisan Market at Mercato in Naples Florida.
Lynn Sheft
Lynn earned her Bachelor of Arts degree from the University of Miami and is a professional writer, author and teacher who also finds designing and hand crafting jewelry rewarding. While living in Connecticut, she was hired at a bead store and the local art center where she taught such techniques as bead stringing, pearl knotting, Kumihimo, bead weaving, wire wrapping and weaving, and chain maille. She also taught paper quilling at the art center and at an art gallery.
For youth programs, her classes in shell art, paper quilling, and cartooning are always popular at Arts Bonita.
Lynn now lives in Naples, Florida, and is happy to be a member of the faculty at Arts Bonita. She is also an author of short stories and novels. Her suspense novels,
The Deadly Game
and
Saving Maria
are available on Amazon and other booksellers.
Mixed Media
Shirley Blake
After many national (and local) workshops over 30 years, Shirley has taught watercolor, mixed media, collage, acrylics, and advanced painting. She received over 50 awards of excellence, merit or honorable in painting and collage. She is a signature member of International Society of Experimental Artists, International Society of Acrylic Painters, and the past President of North Star Watermedia Society (350 members) in Minnesota. She has sold over 1000 paintings.
Shirley's paintings were featured in two different abstract painting books.
Maggie Henry
My art journey has been a life long process. For most of my life I have been interested in my personal discovery that comes with
experimenting and working with many different materials and different modalities.
My art is a discovery process. I find a subject that interests me and then I work to make my vision a reality. For me all subjects in the natural world have always had an appeal to me. Through the play of light, shadows, subtle changes in color and my attention to detail, my paintings take on a life of their own.
Currently I paint with watercolor and acrylics which lend themselves beautifully to my artwork. I love the versatility of these mediums, for they are water based, and are they are an asset to my work. I love to create mixed media collage work using these same mediums, along with hand painted and hand stamped art tissue.
From watercolor painting to mixed media collage each form of these arts add to my knowledge and my skill level. By loving all things in nature, I can share my passion with you and hopefully express that emotion or feeling to you... the viewer, the buyer of my art.
To see all of my latest art work you can visit me at:
Www.ArtByMaggieHenry.com
Painting/Drawing
Carol Broman
Carol is a graduate of the Water Street Atelier and Grand Central Academy in New York, currently living in Fort Myers.
"I have always been drawn to representational work, as a means of intimately connecting with a subject in the clearest and most widely understood language possible. The human form is of special interest to me, as both a psychological and metaphysical creative focus. As an artist, I task myself with trying to absorb great detail, while at the same time, selectively editing this information to evoke a meaningful experience of beauty."
Leigh Greco
Leigh Greco‘s work reflects her lifelong love of vibrant, intense colors interacting with light in tropical landscapes and foliage.
Her experience includes teaching adults, children, and high school students drawing, panting and design throughout collier county schools. Leigh received a Bachelors degree from the University of Florida and a Master's degree in Art from FIU. Her work has been shown in many exhibits and galleries in Southwest Florida and currently can be seen at Naples CoCo Gallery and at her studio in the Naples Art district.
Sculpture & Stone
Doug Corsini
Doug Corsini's passion and talent became evident at the age of 10, earning awards and a scholarship to Rhode Island School of Design's youth program. After high school Doug studied at The Art Institute of Boston, and then attended The Boston Museum School of Fine Art with a focus on sculpture and design. His post-graduate work was done at the Vatican School of the Arts in Florence, Italy. Doug credits his inspiration from Europe's great artists, Da Vinci, Michelangelo, Bellini, Raphael and William Turner. For several decades Doug worked out of his studio in Rhode Island as a commission sculptor, creating sculptures for well-known institutions and corporations. Doug's skills and talents are now shared with others, teaching Modeling in Clay, Portrait and Figure, Wax Carving for Bronze Sculpture, and Stone Carving at the Centers for the Arts Bonita Springs. Doug is also working on his sculpture focusing in perfusion of cells 3-D, captured with bronzes and a polychrome matrix, which will be colorful and exciting.
Terrie Mertens
As a public high school teacher for 33 years, Terrie served as Director of Student Activities as well as Art Department head and coordinator of the Advanced Placement Program in Art. Her expertise was in curriculum development and pilot programs in the arts that served as models for art programs statewide. Terrie studied stone carving with the master stone sculptor at the Sharon Gainsberg Studios. An accomplished artist, Terrie has exhibited work in watercolor, clay and stone, and is currently pursuing her passion for stone carving and teaching at Arts Bonita.
Watercolor
Judy Ladd
Judy Ladd graduated from Western Michigan University with a BA degree in art, she received an MFA from Notre Dame. She worked at the South Bend Art Center teaching children and adult classes, as well as being the faculty representative to the board for years. Her first teaching assignment was at Darden school in first grade and later moved to LaSalle High School as an art instructor. At the high school level, she was art department chairman, worked on The Scholastic Art Awards and the Third Congressional Art Competition which her student won the district award which was presented in New York. During that time, she opened up a co-op gallery which housed 30 local artists.
Throughout the years, she served as president of the Northern Indiana Artists and also became involved in the St. Joseph Watercolor Society in which she ran their Leeper Park Art Fair for 24 years.
Susan Schu
ltz
Susan Schultz graduated from The Ohio State University with a degree in Visual Communications. She is the recipient of the
National Award for Portraiture and is i
nternationally recognized for her Underground Railroad Sculpture.
Performing Arts
Marissa Jankowski
Marissa Jankowski is originally from the San Fransisco Bay Area, California. She began dancing at the age of 2 and continued for 16 years of study in the styles of Ballet, Jazz, Tap, Contemporary, Lryical, Hip Hop and Pointe. She was awarded many regional/ national titles and scholarships. Her intensive Ballet and Contemporary professional training continued at Alonzo King Lines in San Francisco. She then attended The American Musical and Dramatic Academy in Los Angeles, California and graduated with honors in receiving a Bachelor of Fine Arts in Dance Theater. She worked for a San Francisco based digital creative studio, Seedwell, dancing in two of their music videos racking up over hundreds of thousands of views on YouTube and aired on Good Morning America. She was an Assistant to Broadway and Television performer Alexis Carra for ‘Dance Masters of America’ convention and renowned dance Teacher/Choreographer Liz Imperio. Also, she was honored to be the Assistant Choreographer and dancer tapping as Gregory Hines to the remastering of the folly sounds for Francis Ford Coppola movie “The Cotton Club Encore”. She has had the privilege of teaching and choreographing for all ages, levels and styles for over the past 15 years. Recent choreography credits include Arts Bonitas Youth Theatre Alice in Wonderland JR. Marissa’s greatest passion is to continue sharing her knowledge and is excited to further educate aspiring performing artists!
